concept.title: MongoDB
concept.shortdesc: The MongoDB destination writes data to MongoDB. To write data to MongoDB, you must define an operation record header attribute in the pipeline. The operation header attribute indicates the operation to perform for each record: insert, upsert, or delete.

conbody.p: MongoDB destinationoverviewdestinationsMongoDBWhen you configure the MongoDB destination, you configure the connection string, database, and collection, and write concern to use. To perform upserts, you must specify a unique key field. When you do not specify a unique key field, upsert records are sent to the stage for error handling.
Note that when performing a delete operation, the destination deletes a maximum of one matching document in MongoDB. It does not delete all matching documents, as is sometimes possible with MongoDB.
